item.title: FARAWAY TRAIN now available for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Previously released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC.

Atmospheric narrative adventure game FARAWAY TRAIN is now available for Switch via Nintendo eShop, publisher AMATA Games and developer Tatamibeya announced.

FARAWAY TRAIN first launched for PC via Steam on June 3, 2021, followed by PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on August 27, 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via AMATA Games:

About

In a train that runs forever, follow the fall of an empire that had boasted of its glory for a long time, and the clues of a noble girl who was forgotten and tossed about by history.

At the end of it all, the train arrives at…

FARAWAY TRAIN is an atmospheric narrative adventure game.

You wake up in an unfamiliar, old-fashioned train and are asked to trace the ephemeral life of Empress Roxelana, who led the world into collapse by using an ancient magical device called the “Nebula Astronomical Disc.” Search the train for clues to uncover the date and location where she used the device.

Along the way, there will be locked cabin doors that impede your progress. The date of each turning point in Roxelana’s life serves as the key to opening these doors. Find and enter the number representing these dates to unlock each door while unraveling more of the story behind the abandoned Empress and the magical device.

As you explore the train, the beautiful, vast scenery outside the train windows will continuously change with procedural generation.
Enjoy the unique scenery spreading out endlessly outside; you will never see the same landscape twice.

The game also offers a Free Mode where the player can freely walk around the train, sit in any seat, look out the train window, and read the ePUB file.

item.title: Tales of Xillia 2 remaster in the works; next remastered Tales of title to be announced relatively soon
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Bandai Namco following an "announce and release what's ready quickly" approach.

A Tales of Xillia 2 remaster is underway, and the announcement of the next remastered Tales of game is expected relatively soon, series producer Yusuke Tomizawa said in the latest issue of Weekly Famitsu.

“We’ve formed teams with several partner development companies, and including projects from the verification stage to the late development stage, there are more than two titles in progress,” Tomizawa said in an interview celebrating the upcoming release of Tales of Xillia Remastered. “The pace of releases depends on the planning and development status—it could speed up or slow down. But even so, we’re hoping to deliver the fans as many titles as possible, as quickly as possible.”

Asked if that means the next remastered project will be announced soon, Tomizawa said, “I’m unfortunately unable to provide specifics about the next title yet. But the timing of the next remastered title announcement should be relatively soon… or at least, that’s the plan.”

As for a remastered Tales of Xillia 2, Tomizawa said, “As mentioned earlier, we’re following an ‘announce and release what’s ready quickly’ approach. In that vein, Xillia 2 is still in progress, which is why it hasn’t been announced. We will do our best to deliver updates as quickly as possible.”

While there has not been a brand-new entry in the Tales of series since 2021’s Tales of Arise, which received a post-game story expansion called “Beyond the Dawn” in 2023, Tomizawa said, “As the Tales of series development team—as we always have throughout the history of the series—we continue to think about and work on new titles. Any announcements regarding a new title will take some time, but alongside the remasters, we are also planning and considering initiatives such as real-life events, merchandise, and various other promotions. Following the 30th anniversary, through the 40th and 50th, we hope to continue creating opportunities for players and characters to experience and share stories in various forms.”

Tales of Xillia Remastered is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on October 31.
